intro: Teline bracteolata, commonly known as the bracteolate teline, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pale yellow flowers. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that are often aromatic, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Teline bracteolata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
